byline.original: By STEVE EDER and TRIP GABRIEL

abstract: Wisconsin election officials say official recount of state's nearly three million votes will begin after Green Party presidential candidate Jill Stein, who initiated recount, pays $3.5 million to cover attendant costs; Stein is also pushing for recounts in Michigan and Pennsylvania, though there has been no evidence of election tampering in any of three states.

keywords.value: Green Party of the United States
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: In Wisconsin, elections officials said on Monday that a recount of the state’s nearly three million votes would most likely begin on Thursday.
snippet: In Wisconsin, elections officials said on Monday that a recount of the state’s nearly three million votes would most likely begin on Thursday....

headline.main: Vote Recount Push Advances, but Reversing Trump’s Win Is Unlikely
headline.print_headline: Recount Push Advances in 3 States, but a Reversal Is Unlikely
